page.title: 10Farming continued
page.content:
A day at Ion Farm Wed.19 June l985
We start the day at 5 am when the cows are fetched from the field and milked. This is a one man job, which takes approx. 2hrs twice a day, the cows will be milked again at 5 pm. Between the milkings the herdsman has to look after the youngstock and do maintenance jobs concerning the dairy unit. At 7 am the man who looks after the beef cattle starts work, first he will look around all the animals to see that they are well, then they are littered up with straw so that they can lie on clean beds. At 7.30 am the arable workers arrive, the general work today consists of repairing a drain and concreting a new cover into place, maintenance on the oil seed rape store,spraying the wheat against pests, resurfacing the floor ,
